sentence.Network_cn: 工人们仍然正在设法用混凝土把反应堆埋起来.

list.abs: To bury or entomb ; inter ., 埋葬埋葬或掩埋 ; 埋葬.
1. 时期entomb trap v. 埋葬；设陷阱n.
many people were entombed in the rubble of the bombed buildings ., 很多人被埋在炸毁的建筑物的瓦砾里.
Sixty men were entombed in the wastes by the mine explosion ., 矿井爆炸 , 60 人被埋在废墟中.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (formerly also as intomb): from Old French entomber, from en- 'in' + tombe 'tomb'

entry.def: If something is entombed, it is buried or permanently trapped by something.

example.ex: The city was entombed in volcanic lava...
The Tel, an artificial mountain, entombs Jericho's ancient past.
example.tran: 泰勒山作为一座人造山掩藏着杰里科过去古老的历史。

entry.def: When a person's dead body is entombed, it is buried in a grave or put into a tomb.

example.ex: Neither of them had any idea how long the body had been entombed.
example.tran: 他们俩谁也不知道这具尸体被埋葬多久了。

means.word_mean: 1. place in a grave or tomb;

sentences.sentence: "Stalin was buried behind the Kremlin wall on Red Square"
"The pharaos were entombed in the pyramids"
"My grandfather was laid to rest last Sunday"
